result.execSummary:
The defendant Christina Lee Orellana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "D" Felony], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)3.
  • Purchase More Than 7.5 Grams of Pseudoephedrine Product within 30-day Period [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3j).
  • Purchase More Than 7.5 Grams of Pseudoephedrine Product within 30-day Period [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3j).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Christina Lee Orellana, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel John K Smerlinski.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant has previously entered pleas on counts 1, 4, and 5. No factual errors in the pre-sentence investigation reports. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Defense notes for the record that they have no witnesses to call. No questions asked of the agent who drafted pre-sentence-investigation report. Discrepancy between joint recommendation and DOJ guidelines is because of PSI information. State gives closing argument. Defense gives closing argument. Defendant makes final statement. Court reviews pre-sentence investigation. Court sentences Defendant to prison and probation as set forth on scanned-in minutes sheets.
PSI to Attorneys

Matter reconvened. Judge Beer appears. District Attorney Craig Nolen, Atty Smerlinski, and Defendant Christina Orellana present in court. Court Reporter Christine Knox in court. Remaining charges to be dismissed and read in. Atty Smerlinski to draft letter to the court.

Christina Lee Orellana, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel John K Smerlinski.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Amended information filed. Plea Questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1, 4, and 5. State requests pre-sentence investigation. Preliminary sentence recommendation is for 6 years of probation on count 1, with 9 months jail as a condition, 84 days credit. Counts 4 and 5 would be 3 years probation on each, concurrent to any other sentence. Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1, 4, 5, court finds defendant guilty. Other charges dismissed and read in for purposes of sentencing. PSI due 03-31-17, Counsel wants a copy.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

John k Smerlinski appearing on behalf of defendant. Christina Lee Orellana, defendant does not appear.
Craig Nolen appearing as prosecuting attorney. Matter set for status conference and possible plea.  Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

John k Smerlinski appearing on behalf of defendant by phone means. Christina Lee Orellana, defendant does not appear.
Craig Nolen appearing as prosecuting attorney. Matter set over to allow counsel to discuss case agreement.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 09:45 am.
from Atty. Smerlinski

Christina Lee Orellana, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel John k Smerlinski.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Matter has no been resolved but counsel is optimistic. Defense to wait for plea offer from DA, and Defense counsel to set plea date directly with court.  Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

John k Smerlinski appearing on behalf of defendant.
Christina Lee Orellana, defendant does not appear.

ADDRESS INFO for Christina Lee Orellana
Current: 1212 23rd St, c/o Julie Ockerman, Monroe, WI 53566 United States  (Effective: 04-15-2016)

Violation - Mf/Deliver Amphetamine APTAC; Know Possess Meth Wast APTAC; Maintain Drug Trafficking Place APTAC; Purchase More Than 7.5 Grams of Pseudoephedrine Product within 30-day Period APTAC 6cts.  Issuing Agency - Monroe PD.
  Must notify District Attorney, Clerk of Court's Office and own Attorney of any address change within 48 hours.  Must surrender passport to the court.  May not leave state of Wisconsin without permission of Court.    May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant. Not to reside in the same residence with co-defendants Alexandra Orellana, Anthony Lopez-Herrera, Jose Orellana. May not possess or purchase any products used in the manufacture of methamphetamine, specifically: pseudophedrine not perscribed to her by a physician currently treating the defendant, coleman fuel, drain cleaner, lithium batteries, sodium hydroxide (typically in the form of powdered lye), amonium nitrate, (typically in the form of icy-cold packs).

Christina Lee Orellana, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Timothy J Burns.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant to live at 1212 23rd Street c/o Julie Ockerman, Alexandra Orellana to live at 1521 8th Street (both in Monroe). Defendant wants an entirely signature bond, granted, $10,000.

Christina Lee Orellana, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Timothy J Burns.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Monroe Police Department Officer Michael Mortimer sworn in on oath and testifies. Defendant identified by witness. Exhibits 1-24 marked. Exhibits 2-5 identified. Exhibits 7-10 identified. Exhibits 1 and 6 identified. Exhibits 11-12 identified. Exhibits 14-15 identified. Exhibits 16-17 identified. Exhibits 18-19 identified. Exhibit 20 identified. Exhibit 21 identified. Exhibit 22 identified. Witness testifies on the process of meth manufacturing, Brief recess while Reporter Denise Severson is relieved by Reporter Christine Knox. Atty Luhman rephrases last question for the reporter's benefit. No cross examination, no further witnesses. Atty Luhman moves Exhibits 1-22 be received into evidence. No witnesses for the defense. Arguments made. Defendant waives reading of Information, stands mute, not guilty plea entered on defendant's behalf. Set for DA PTC 03-01-2016 10:30, bonds to continue.
Atty. Timothy Burns
